title: Ticket #680: Allow selection of which param table to use at compile time
description:
Add a simple way to specify at compile time which grand unified param table to use. The idea is we could commit into git different sets of defaults, and then compile up customized releases of Condor.

For example, we could build an special OSG release of Condor, a TeraGrid release of Condor, etc, and each release could have a different set of config knob defaults and different unalterable knobs (see #679) to enforce important policies (e.g. "all OSG Condor installations must use GSI security, thus the OSG release of Condor has GSI security setup as an unalterable configuration").
